title: A First Course in Bayesian Statistical Methods
content: Compact graduate-level introduction with examples in R; useful for advanced users.

title: A Practical Introduction to Bayesian Estimation of Causal Effects
content: Combines Bayesian modeling and causal inference, with open code examples.

title: An Introduction to Bayesian Thinking
content: Short, freely available online text suitable for early introduction to Bayesian concepts.

title: ArviZ
content: Diagnostics, visualization, and utilities for analyzing Bayesian model output from PyMC, Stan, etc.

title: Bambi
content: High-level formula interface for Bayesian regression and multilevel models, built on PyMC.

title: bayes4psy
content: Teaching-oriented Bayesian models for psychology (t-test, bootstrapping, reaction time models).

title: Bayesian Composite Models in Chemistry
content: Demonstrates composite Bayesian modeling approaches in chemical and molecular contexts.

title: Bayesian Methods in Evolutionary Biology (BEAST)
content: Used widely in molecular evolution; tutorial resources available with BEAST software.

title: BEAST / BEAST X
content: Bayesian MCMC software for molecular phylogenetics, with tutorials.

title: Doing Bayesian Data Analysis
content: Tutorial style text bridging conceptual understanding and coding practice; includes R and JAGS examples.

title: dynesty
content: Nested sampling for posterior and evidence estimation; useful for multimodal or complex posteriors.

title: Flexible Bayesian Pharmacometric Modeling with Stan & Torsten
content: Demonstrates Bayesian modeling for drug dosing and PK/PD models in life sciences.

title: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics Applied to Life Sciences
content: Covers conjugate priors, occupancy models, and JAGS; domain-centered for life sciences instructors.

title: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics (Bolstad)
content: Classic introduction covering conjugate priors, MCMC, and regression.

title: JASP
content: Open-source, user-friendly software for Bayesian and frequentist statistical analysis. GUI-based, great for instructors and students without coding experience.

title: Neuromatch Tutorial 2: Bayesian Inference and Decisions
content: Interactive notebook teaching continuous hidden-state Bayesian inference and decision theory.

title: OpenBUGS
content: Classic Bayesian modeling via Gibbs sampling; many legacy models and interoperability.

title: Practical Bayesian Inference in Neuroscience
content: Recent paper and open toolbox showing Bayesian inference in neuroscience; useful as a practical example.

title: STATS 331: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics (Lecture notes)
content: Open course notes under CC-BY-SA; adaptable for instructors.

title: Think Bayes 2
content: A gentle, computational introduction to Bayesian statistics using Python and Jupyter notebooks.
